newsitem.title: UK: Scottish Radio buys N. Ireland's Downtown.
newsitem.headline: Scottish Radio buys N. Ireland's Downtown.

text.p: Scottish Radio Holdings Plc said it has agreed to buy Community Radio Services Plc, better known as Downtown Radio in Northern Ireland, for a maximum of 9.7 million stg.
Scottish Radio is offering 33.5 new shares and 119 stg in cash for every 100 Downtown shares, valuing Downtown shares at around 240p.
Downtown shareholders can elect to vary the mix of cash and shares within limits.
Scottish Radio said its offer represents a multiple of 16.7 times Downtown's profits after tax for the year to September 1995.
It said the acquisition "creates scope for enhanced earnings per share."
